days.title: Beginning the Purification from one drawer
days.description: Start your spring cleaning by clearing one small closet or drawer. Discard unused tools to make space for the Fravahars (ancestral spirits) to soar through your home. Learn more: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fravashi

days.title: Donating What You No Longer Need

days.title: Cleaning Mirrors and Frames
days.description: Mirrors symbolize clarity and truth. Cleaning them prepares us to face the new year honestly. ğŸª

days.title: Refreshing Spices
days.description: Discard old spices and wipe down the shelves. The fresh scent of herbs should never be mixed with the smell of staleness. ğŸŒ¿

days.title: Washing Light Curtains
days.description: Wash sheer curtains and hang them while damp so the scent of cleanliness and novelty fills the room. ğŸªŸ

days.title: Cleaning Lamps
days.description: Clean every glass and crystal of your lamps one by one. The house must be full of 'Forough' (radiance) during the festival nights. ğŸ’¡

days.title: Caring for Plants

days.title: Dusting the Library, Shahnameh, and Hafez
days.description: Dust your library and pick a place for the Shahnameh (The Book of Kings) and the Divan of Hafez on the Nowruz table. On Nowruz, many Iranians read classic poems together. Poetry is a way of reflecting, hoping, and connecting across generations. Help keep this beautiful tradition alive by choosing your favorite poet or writer and reading a few lines together. ğŸ“–âœ¨ your can read more about Shahname here : https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shahnameh

days.title: Cleaning Living Room Windows
days.description: Clean the glass so the 'Sheed' (radiant light) of the spring sun shines perfectly into the house. A clean window opens the heart. â˜€ï¸

days.title: Cleaning the Fridge
days.description: Remove old food and wash shelves. Remove old food to make room for fresh holiday feasts. ğŸ§Š

days.title: Storing Winter Clothes
days.description: Gather warm, woolly garments and put them in storage. It is time for the closets to be released from the weight of winter. ğŸ§¥

days.title: Preparing Spring Clothes
days.description: Bring out light and bright-colored clothes. Joyful colors transform the human soul for the New Year. ğŸ‘—

days.title: Cleaning the Stove

days.title: Washing Cushion Covers
days.description: Wash small textiles like cushions and runners. Small changes refresh the home. ğŸ›‹ï¸

days.title: Tidying the Entrance
days.description: Clean the doorway and shoe area. The entrance sets the tone for the year. ğŸšª

days.title: Cleaning Hidden Corners

days.title: Cleaning Walls and Switches
days.description: Wipe stains off the walls and attend to the light switches. When small details are clean, the whole house suddenly shines.âœ¨

days.title: Cleaning Appliances
days.description: Clean kitchen appliances so theyâ€™re ready for busy holidays. ğŸ½ï¸

days.title: Starting Sabzeh (Sprouts)
days.description: Soak seeds to grow green sprouts. Sabzeh represents rebirth and life. https://youtu.be/mfWr2yTw4pM?si=_4ozN5gX3Og4MqV5 ğŸŒ±

days.title: Washing Guest Dishes
days.description: Prepare special dishes for guests. Hospitality is key to Nowruz. ğŸ½ï¸

days.title: Caring for Shoes and Bags
days.description: Clean and organize shoes and bags. Being prepared matters. ğŸ‘ğŸ‘œ

days.title: Deep Cleaning the Bathroom
days.description: Clean the bathroom thoroughly and refresh towels. Clean water symbolizes purity. ğŸš¿

days.title: Preparing Senjed and Sumac
days.description: Senjed (dried oleaster) and Sumac are two traditional items on the Haft-Sin table. Senjed symbolizes love and wisdom, while sumac represents sunrise, patience, and the triumph of light. If you canâ€™t find them, check a local Persian store, or feel free to skip them or even use a small drawing instead; the meaning matters more than perfection. ğŸŒ°ğŸ¨âœ¨

days.title: Look for signs of Spring
days.description: Take a walk and look for signs of spring. The first flowers, birds, and warmer air are all part of the Nowruz spirit. ğŸŒ¸ğŸ¦

days.title: Final Floor Cleaning
days.description: Clean floors with a pleasant scent. The home should feel fresh everywhere. ğŸ§¼

days.title: Organizing Photo Albums
days.description: Take a look at old photos and reminisce about happy memories. Nowruz is a time to connect with our roots.

days.title: Preparing Garlic and Vinegar
days.description: Get the garlic and vinegar ready. Garlic symbolizes protection, and vinegar represents patience and blessing.

days.title: Buying Fresh Red Apples
days.description: Select ripe, red apples. The apple is a symbol of beauty, health, and prosperity.

days.title: Planning the Festival of Red Fire
days.description: Seven days until fire festival 'Chaharshanbe Suri'!. In this day Iranians gather around, dance and jump over small fires to leave sickness behind. If you want to host a gathering, coordinate with relatives and friends starting today. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chaharshanbe_Suri

days.title: Samanu - Step 1: Soaking and Sprouting
days.description: Making Samanu is a big deal! Do it if you're looking for a challenge. It was traditionaly made by big groups in a very big pot , but nowadays many do it at their home. If you want to do it , you should clean the high-quality wheat and let it soak to sprout. This is the beginning of creating one of the most powerful 'Sins' (elements) of the table. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samanu, check this video on how to make it: https://youtu.be/_DnyRStVb7Q?si=Nd9qtmCDkTCMxhVq

days.title: Samanu - Step 2: Tending to the Wheat
days.description: Check the Samanu wheat regularly. Don't let them dry out; they are preparing the juice of life for the Samanu.

days.title: Samanu - Step 3: Tending to the Sprouts
days.description: Check the wheat sprouts regularly and water them. The growth of these sprouts heralds the arrival of spring.

days.title: Polishing the Mirror and Haft-Sin Glass
days.description: Shine the mirror and prepare the beautiful glasses for the layout so they glow on the Nowruz table.

days.title: Samanu - Step 4: Cooking
days.description: Now that the sprouts have turned silver, extract their juice and cook it with flour until your Samanu (wheat germ pudding) is ready. checkout again this video if needed: https://youtu.be/_DnyRStVb7Q?si=Nd9qtmCDkTCMxhVq

days.title: Preparation for the Night of Fire
days.description: Tomorrow is Chaharshanbe Suri! Prepare the nuts and snacks, pick out some dancable music and get ready for a night full of passion and energy.

days.title: Festival of Red Fire (Chaharshanbe Suri)
days.description: Tonight is for jumping over the fire. Give your yellowness (sickness) to the fire and take back its redness (vitality/health). If you can't light a fire, you can jump over a small candle which many people do nowadays living in apartments. ğŸ”¥

days.title: Preparing for Sabzi-Polo with Fish
days.description: For the New Year's Eve dinner of Sabzi-Polo (herb rice) with fish, wash the fresh herbs and prepare the fish. link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sabzi_polo

days.title: Arranging Sweets and Nuts
days.description: Arrange delicious Persian treats and 'Ajil' (nuts) in special dishes. The house now smells of spring.

days.title: Cooking Sabzi-Polo with Fish
days.description: Complete the last meal of the year with Sabzi-Polo (herb rice) and fish. The scent of fresh herbs and garlic will fill the home. https://youtu.be/ERKLw_B8Weo?si=1JXSuZIzFroSSPCA

days.title: Nowruz and the Turning of the Year
days.description: Burn wild rue (Espand) and frankincense, wear new clothes, and sit by the Haft-Sin table. Give a call to your loved ones. Take pictures and share the joy. The 7 'S' symbols are: 1. Sabzeh (Rebirth) 2. Samanu (Power/Strength) 3. Senjed (Love/Wisdom) 4. Seer (Health/Medicine) 5. Seeb (Beauty) 6. Somaq (Sunrise/Patience) 7. Serkeh (Immortal Patience). Nowruz Pirooz! https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haft-sin
